DOC.brief_summary: The investigator propose test efficacy Reproductive Health Survivorship Care Plan ( SCP-R ) , novel survivorship care tool meet reproductive health need young breast cancer survivor ( YBCS ) . Most YBCS undergo chemotherapy and/or endocrine therapy , treatment impair ovarian function result significant reproductive health late effect . These late effect include symptom estrogen deprivation hot flash , fertility concern , limited contraception option sexual problem . Together major , negative impact quality life . Despite substantial research , treatment guideline clinical expertise issue , YBCS healthcare provider limit guidance best manage reproductive health late effect . The research team generate practical , accessible , evidence-based reproductive health survivorship care plan ( SCP-R ) YBCS provider address deficit survivorship care . This clinical trial test YBCS receive web-based SCP-R likely control improve least one reproductive health issue : hot flash , sexual health , fertility concern , contraception .
DOC.detailed_description: Participants may recruit throughout United States , study activity may do remotely . It necessary live San Diego visit UC San Diego participate study . YBCS interested study provide access online screen survey determine eligibility . Eligible YBCS consent study follow 24 week . Following one-week study run , YBCS participant randomize SCPR intervention control arm receive corresponding intervention . All YBCS participant complete 3 study time point enrollment , 12 24 week . At time point , complete web-based study questionnaire medical reproductive health . YBCS participant also daily track hot flash via text messaging . YBCS participant designate healthcare provider would discuss reproductive health issue . Designated healthcare provider approach participate study . Those provider enroll complete 2 study assessment week 0 24 . At study time point , HCP assess preparedness manage reproductive health issue web-based questionnaire .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion : Breast cancer ( Stages 0III ) diagnosis Breast cancer diagnosis age ≤ 45 year ≤ 5 year since breast cancer diagnosis Current age 18 50 year Completed treatment surgery , radiation chemotherapy ( applicable ) Able read English Able consent study Access Internet connection Exclusion : • Women pregnant recruitment
